#Text=Use New and Traditional Media to Market Your Business
#Text=Right now in 2010 , there is no such thing as " the right way to advertise . "

column1: #Text=As technology magnifies the infinite number of possibilities to brand an idea , many businesses are confused when it comes to social media platforms .
#Text=Likewise , many companies are making use of online tactics but failing to realize their significance and how to best use them .
#Text=Many are also forgetting about traditional media , and this is a problem .
#Text=So what 's the best way to stay competitive in an ocean full of emerging media ?
#Text=It 's simple !
#Text=Every business should maintain a healthy balance of both new , online tactics as well as traditional media platforms .
#Text=Contrary to popular belief , print is not dead .
#Text=If you are a business owner , it 's time to cross over to hybrid marketing .
#Text=This is how you can use new media and traditional media to market your business .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Stay current on the web .

#Text=If your website is rarely updated , be sure to stay connected to your followers through blogs and other ( free ) social media websites like Twitter , Facebook , YouTube , StumbleUpon , and Merchant Circle .
#Text=Use new media platforms wisely .
#Text=Do n't sign up for social media websites if you do n't know how to use them .
#Text=Research how to use each tool effectively , and only involve yourself with sites that fit your company 's business model accordingly .
#Text=If you do n't know why you are doing something , you probably should n't do it. .
#Text=yet .
#Text=Find a way to properly make use of each social platform before making random posts .
#Text=Create a conversation around your brand .
#Text=Using new media platforms such as Twitter will create engagement .
#Text=You want your customers , clients , business partners , and affiliates to interact with your brand as much as possible .
#Text=Tweeting keeps your brand at the top of their mind .
#Text=Get your audience excited .
#Text=Raising brand awareness is more than putting fliers up and hoping for banner ad clicks , it 's creating an environment , a user experience , or a feeling that makes everyone want more .
#Text=It 's all about lasting impressions .
#Text=Do n't neglect traditional media .
#Text=Even the greatest campaigns combine both online tactics with traditional advertising .
#Text=You may have a great website , and an even cooler Facebook page , but how will your 9-5 workers who are stuck in rush hour until 6'oclock going to know where to find you ?
#Text=Think big and go bigger .
#Text=Truck side advertising , billboards , guerrilla tactics , and outdoor signage are all cost-effective tactics that make a big impact and spark interest .
#Text=Print big .
#Text=Right now , it 's all about visibility .
#Text=Why stay cooped up in a building with a tiny door logo that 's hard to find ?
#Text=You can fully wrap your office building , design eye-popping window graphics , and maximize your space with full color murals and floor graphics .
#Text=The key to brand awareness is connectivity .
#Text=Why have a great logo if is n't plastered all over your walls ?
#Text=Why host an open house without larger than life advertising ?
#Text=Think big and use large format printing to your best advantage .
#Text=Stay competitive and research trends .
#Text=Do n't just follow trends , try to do something different and unique in the spaces you compete in .
#Text=If your competitors have more tweets than you , think about an exclusive Twitter campaign to boost your own page .
#Text=The more time and creativity you invest in , the more results you 'll see in the end .
